items.sentence: It\'s one of the dumbest things I\'ve ever done.
Are you telling me not to go to Boston with Tom?
How many days does it usually take to get there?
How many glasses of wine do you drink every day?
How would you like to go fishing this afternoon?
I agree with everything Tom said at the meeting.
I\'ve done that and I\'m sure I\'ll do it again.
I know what\'s going to happen tomorrow morning.
I think Tom can speak French, but I\'m not sure.
I think Tom didn\'t do what he said he would do.
I think Tom didn\'t understand your explanation.
I think Tom doesn\'t know how to cook spaghetti.
I think Tom doesn\'t know how to play this game.
I told Tom we\'d be in Boston by 2:30 on Monday.
You are the last person that I expected to meet.
You can see the Empire State Building from here.
Why does the US government let people have guns?
That was Tom\'s idea, not mine. Don\'t blame me.
Tom is the only one here who doesn\'t know Mary.
Tom is the only one who laughs at Mary\'s jokes.
Tom isn\'t as good at French as he thinks he is.
Who\'s the man that\'s leaning against the gate?
All of Tom\'s children are able to speak French.
Apparently, Tom\'s car needs a new set of tires.
Don\'t worry. I told you everything would be OK.
I\'ll phone you as soon as I get to the airport.
I\'ll take care of my parents when they get old.
I\'m at the hospital. I got struck by lightning.
I\'m glad that I was able to help you last week.
I\'m going to Boston next week to see my sister.
I like swimming, but I don\'t like to swim here.
Could you please tell me again why you are late?
Could you please tell me your height and weight?
Could you recommend a nice restaurant near here?
Did you go straight home after school yesterday?
Did you really expect him to tell you the truth?
Did you see anybody else in the park that night?
My neighbor\'s son was killed by a drunk driver.
You\'re the only one who\'s not able to do that.
This is definitely more fun than doing homework.
This is your last chance to spend time with Tom.
Tom and Mary are always competing for attention.
Tom and Mary both noticed John at the same time.
Eventually, Tom will realize that he needs help.
Have you told everyone when the meeting will be?
How old were you when your parents got divorced?
I always have two cups of coffee in the morning.
I\'ve tried to do that, but I just can\'t do it.
If I\'d known where Tom was, I\'d have told you.
I wish I could figure out how to make this work.
I shouldn\'t have to do all this work by myself.
I\'ve spent the entire morning cleaning my room.
Tom doesn\'t want the same thing to happen here.
You\'re a few years older than Tom, aren\'t you?
You\'re going to be late if you don\'t hurry up.
Tom and Mary had a romantic picnic by the river.
Tom and Mary have always been very good friends.
Tom and Mary have been studying French together.
Tom and Mary have been together for three years.
Tom and Mary have never been to that restaurant.
Tom and Mary have only been married three weeks.
Almost all of Tom\'s ex-wives still talk to him.
Tom and I don\'t like the same kind of TV shows.
How do you think you\'d look wearing that dress?
Scientists haven\'t found a cure for cancer yet.
Do you feel pain in any other part of your body?
Do you have the same thing in a different color?
Do you know of any good restaurants around here?
Don\'t stick your nose where it doesn\'t belong.
Don\'t you think you should tell Tom about this?
Even if I were rich, I wouldn\'t give him money.
Everybody here knows that Tom doesn\'t eat pork.
She couldn\'t convince him to buy her a new car.
She didn\'t want him to go out with other women.
The only person Tom says he\'ll talk to is Mary.
Tom can\'t cook very well, so he often eats out.
Are you going to be able to do that by yourself?
Did Tom say anything to you about what happened?
Did you ask Tom what he thought the problem was?
Did you invite Tom to dinner without telling me?
Did you know that Tom used to work in Australia?
Did you really expect Tom to tell you the truth?
Tom has a pain in his big toe on his right foot.
Tom has been living abroad for a very long time.
Tom has been looking after Mary for three years.
Tom has been sitting on the riverbank for hours.
Tom has told Mary all he knows about the matter.
If Tom does that, then we won\'t have a problem.
Tom often complains about his mother\'s cooking.
It would be better for you to stay in bed today.
It would be helpful if you could do that for me.
Tom eats at least three bowls of rice every day.
Tom finished his homework before going to sleep.
Tom got back in his Jeep and started the engine.
Tom handed the bowl of buttered popcorn to Mary.
Tom has been accused of shooting an unarmed man.
You\'re the first woman I\'ve ever really loved.
I wish I had the time to stay and talk with you.
I wish that I could speak French as well as Tom.
You should\'ve rejected such an unfair proposal.
